dialogues.text: There's gotta be something you can do. INT. ELI’S ROOM - NIGHT - LATER Eli lies in bed, staring at the locked door, his face shrouded in darkness. Haley stands at the window, trying be productive. Eli doesn’t face her when he answers.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Haley, forget it. She changed the code. There’s nothing I can do.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Think, Eli.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I can’t think. I just want to go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Don’t say that. We’re so close-- Eli sits up, turns to Haley aggressively.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: We?! What do you mean, we?! Eli’s never been this aggressive with Haley. He looks cra threatening; it spooks Haley.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: I just meant--- Eli stands, makes his way menacingly towards the window.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I’m going to die in here, Haley. Just like all the others. And you're going to still be out there catching tadpoles.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: You're not going to die, Eli, don’t say that. 8FLiX.com SCREENPLAY DATABASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haley’s trying to fight back tears at this point. Eli doe care, he’s lost all semblance of self control.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Why don’t you just get out of here? I never asked for your help, and I don’t want it now. So just leave me alone and let me DIE! Haley bursts into tears. She turns her back on Eli so he can’t see her cry. And suddenly, Eli sees not a tough country girl before hi but a sad, scared kid, like himself. Which is probably wh she’s been all along. It sucks his anger away like a vacuum.

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Haley, I’m sorry. Don’t cry. I didn’t mean it. I don’t know why I said that stuff. It’s like I don’t even feel like myself anymore. After a few more sniffles, Haley manages to get herself b together. She turns to face him.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: I wasn’t crying. A bug flew in my eye. Even with all that’s happening, Eli manages a brief smile Haley back to her old self again.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: What should I do, Haley? I can’t be in this house another second.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Well, you were able to get in her wing before.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Yeah, but that’s because The Ghosts helped--- Eli cuts himself off. Whatever he realized, Haley did too

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: It’s worth a try. 8FLiX.com SCREENPLAY DATABASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli creeps through the hallway. It’s dark, and he doesn’t dare turn on the light. He’s got his flashlight with him. Listens for the sound of Mom and Dad. It’s all quiet. The coast is clear. He heads for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen light is on and Eli stops beside the doorway. someone’s in there, he might be spotted. He peers inside. And there’s DAD, sitting at the kitchen table, staying wa But, something looks odd. Eli realizes, HE’S ASLEEP. As long as Eli’s quiet enough, he should be able to get p Dad no problem. He moves. INT. OUTSIDE MOM AND DAD’S BEDROOM —- SECOND FLOOR - NIGH Eli very quietly puts his ear up to Mom and Dad’s door, listens in. No sounds from within. Mom must be asleep too He makes his move up to Dr. Horn’s wing. INT. THIRD FLOOR HALLWAY/OUTSIDE DR. HORN’S WING - NIGHT The RED LIGHT on the keypad stands out in the darkness. Eli stands at the door. He doesn’t really know how to beg He looks towards the ceiling, like that’1l help.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Um, it’s Eli. I need your help. I need you to unlock the door. Eli stares at the red light, waiting for it to go green. doesn’t. Eli tries again, more conviction this time:

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t know if you can hear me, but I really, really need you to open the door. Still just red light. Eli closes his eyes, one final try. 8FLiX.com SCREENPLAY DATABASE

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If I can’t get in here, I’m going to die. So please, I’m going to open my eyes, and please let this light be green. This is my last chance. Please-- THE GHOST BOY (Perry) passes in FRONT OF FRAME, practical blur. Eli doesn’t see it because his eyes are closed. But he opens them now... And the light is green. Eli could cry he’s so happy. But there’s no time for that. He quietly opens the door... The Ghost Boy (Perry), stands motionless on the other end Eli doesn’t move, fear and excitement coursing through hi After all, there’s a dead child standing before him, frie or not. INT. DR. HORN’S ROOM - NIGHT Dr. Horn’s room is tiny, even in the darkness Eli can tel He stands in the door, shines the flashlight around: the place is bare, frightfully so. Like someplace a squatter might sleep, or a crazy person. In place of a bed there’s an army style cot, nothing more than a sheet for a blanket. THE HOLY BIBLE lies on top. And so far, that’s the only thing in the place...until El shines his light on a_lone bookcase against a wall. The bookcase is completely empty, and Eli examines it mor closely with the light. He uses the underside of an empty shelf to lift the entire thing. It’s heavy but not bad, a he moves the bookcase a few feet over to the right. When he steps away, what he sees shocks him... Behind the bookcase is a dark hallway, a black abyss that begs to be left alone, to turn away from and never look b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Ghost (Perry, again) stands at the other end of the sec hallway, in front of a door, a big red symbol painted on we can’t make out. It doesn’t startle Eli this time. 8FLiX.com SCREENPLAY DATABASE

dialogues.text: Eli enters the hallway, towards the door. When he gets cl enough he can make out the symbol. It’s a_snake, coiled i circle, devouring it’s own tail. The technical term is OUROBORUS, but Eli doesn’t know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli's adrenaline skyrockets. This is it, this is what he meant to find. His heart is beating out of his chest. The sound of his quickened breaths echo in the hallway. Eli pushes the doo open slightly; speckles of dust dance about in the beam o his flashlight from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps backwards, frightened, covers up his face with h hands, terrified to breath. He looks back out towards the hallway he came from; going out now would mean failure an certain death. He came too far to quit now. After a contemplative beat, Eli pushes his t-shirt over t bridge of his nose. It’s no hazmat suit, but it’1l have t do. He opens the door the rest of the way and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room’s nothing but a big concrete square. There’s a b lightbulb hanging in the center of the room, Eli clicks i on. It casts an ugly yellow glow. Eli doesn’t need the flashlight anymore so he turns it of Ahead of him, painted on the floor, is a A LARGE OUROBORU Within the circle is a OLD WOODEN CHEST, about six feet l and four feet wide.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Is this it? Is this what you wanted me to find? At first, it appears as though Eli is speaking to himself But Eli turns his head, THE CAMERA PANS WITH HIM, to REVE Perry standing next to him. Eli steps into the circle of The Ouroborus, looks back an Perry is gone. The chest is covered in dust. Eli grabs the handle with a outstretched hand, careful not get too close. He opens slowly, so as not to disturb the particles. CRRRRREEEAAK. The sound the old chest opening fills the r It’s open now, but Eli can’t see inside from where he is. 8FLiX.com SCREENPLAY DATABASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets closer, leans in. It’s still too dark to see, the yellow light not bring enough. He clicks on his flashlight, and points it inside the chest...and the DEAD FACE of Perry stares back at him. No a_ghost, but as a corpse - rotting, mouth agape. The eyes have long since rotted out, leaving empty black sockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beneath Perry's body are the bodies of the other patients most of them just skeletons by this point. There’s a NOISE behind Eli. It must be Perry. Eli turns.. But it isn’t Perry. Someone’s running after him. It’s got be Dr. Horn, but we can’t make our her face.

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got you Dr. Horn! I--- Eli aims the flashlight at Dr. Horn’s face...and WE SEE i isn’t Dr. Horn at all...

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mom? Almost impossibly, it’s MOM who’s running towards him. Th Eli into confusion. What’s she doing up here?

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mom...what are you...? Mom stops at the door. Stares at Eli with a TEAR IN HER E

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Eli. She SLAMS the Ouroborus Door shut _on Eli! Eli races towa the door tries to open it from the inside.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Mom, it’s me! There’s dust everywhere, open the--- There’s an audible THUNK as the door locks from outside. Eli’s eyes go wide: what the hell is going on? With each panicked breath he inhales the dus billowing off the door and permeating the air.

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please, let me out! Mom, please! 8FLiX.com SCREENPLAY DATABASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His breathing becomes raspy, his throat closes up.

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (gasping) Mom...help...can’t...breath... FROM OUTSIDE: Eli HEARS more footsteps. Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Linda, what...? Eli uses the rest of his energy to plead with Dad, prayin will help him.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Dad! Help...I’m...trapped...dust... But there’s no help. Instead he HEARS:

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He knows.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No. How?! Eli can’t bang any longer. His vision begins to blur. He slumps to the ground. What in the hell is happening? He HEARS Mom and Dad’s footsteps heading away, leading ou towards Dr. Horn’s room.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Call Dr. Horn. Tell her to get back here. Immediately. The SOUND Dr. Horn’s bedroom door closing. Then, nothing. All Eli can hear are his own shallow, raspy breaths. He faints.

dialogues.text: WE’RE IN ELI’S POV AGAIN. THE DOG NIGHTMARE.

dialogues.text: The SLEEPING DOG is ahead of us...We WALK towards it...It looks at us, SNAPS... But instead of waking up now, we GRAB the dog by the scuf subdue it... 8FLiX.com SCREENPLAY DATABASE

dialogues.text: Hi, honey. Mom's wavering voice comes through the door. Eli winces, if the voice were a palpable thing, capable of physical h

dialogues.text: Mom...Why are you doing this? There’s a LONG BEAT, then:

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Because you’re sick.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: But...I’m not sick, am I? More silence from outside the room. Eli stands at attenti now, his fear diminishing, but his rage building.

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: We had to honey. It-- Eli cuts her off. He moves closer to the door, his anger growing with the ever increasing pulse of his heart.

dialogues.speaker: ARE YOU DOING THIS TO ME
dialogues.text: GO! LET ME Go! He’s so loud he doesn’t hear the adults retreating back t the library. He does however, hear the closing of the bookcase.

dialogues.text: Eli sits with his back against the wall. He’s drawing a c picture of Haley in the dust on the floor with his finger

dialogues.speaker: ELI

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But now I’m going to end up just like you. Again, WE REVEAL Eli's talking to Perry, along with the r of The Ghosts. In an odd way, they almost look like frien

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Were your parents in on it too? Did they trick you like they tricked me? Eli gets up, goes to the wooden chest. Opens it up. 8FLiX.com SCREENPLAY DATABASE

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I guess you can’t get me out of here huh? Eli looks back at Perry and The Ghosts. They’re perched j around the border of the Ouroborus. dialogues.text: Eli? She spots Eli on the ground doing a swell acting job. Dr. Horn thinks for a brief moment, then fully enters the roo She quickly goes towards Eli and reaches down to check hi pulse. The moment he feels her fingers on his skin, his e SHOOT OPEN. 8FLiX.com SCREENPLAY DATABASE

dialogues.text: He grabs her wrist and pulls her towards him, with his ot hand HE SWINGS something oblong toward her head. He conne there’s an audible THUD, and Dr. Horn stumbles backwards. dialogues.text: Eli bolts down the staircase as fast as he can. He’s maki haste, but he’s noisy. Mom opens her door, spots him.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Shit! Eli, no! Eli doesn’t look back, just keeps running.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Paul, he’s out! Stop him! Stop him! Mom chases after him but her door slams shut, seemingly o its own. Eli looks back, sees Perry holding the door shut Eli charges ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Eli, calm down. I can’t let you leave. Drop that and we’ll talk. Okay, son? Eli looks at the LARGE OAK ARMOIRE next to Dad. The Ghost stand next to it, they mean to push it over.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: You better look out. Dad doesn’t understand what he’s talking about it.

dialogues.text: Eli, everything’s going to be--- Dad looks to his right; the armoire falls, a potential killing blow if it were to land on him. He leaps to safet the armoire crashes to the ground. Eli turns back the way he came. Races towards his room.

To Dad, it looks like these things are happening on their own. But from Eli’s perspective, it’s The Ghosts helping Eli navigates down the hallway, he can see his room. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HALLWAY OUTSIDE ELI’S ROOM - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS Dad pushes on the door but it won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Open the door, Eli. You don’t understand what's happening here. Open the door! INT. ELI’S ROOM - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS Eli keeps smashing. He’s losing energy fast. Haley unzips her tent, confused. She sees Eli struggling, quickly realizes what’s happening.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Eli!

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: It won’t break! I can’t get out! INT. HALLWAY OUTSIDE ELI’S ROOM - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS Dad keeps trying the door. He puts his shoulder into it a it gives slightly. Mom comes racing to Dad’s side. She’s got Dr. Horn, who’s bleeding pretty badly from the head.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Jesus! Did Eli--?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HORN
dialogues.text: We cannot let him leave!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Something’s blocking the door. I can’t get it open. Dr. Horn places her shoulder up against the door with Dad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them push on the door with all their might. INT. ELI’S ROOM - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS Eli’s run out of steam. The window is spidered all over, it’s not broken, and there’s no way it’s going to. 8FLiX.com SCREENPLAY DATABASE

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: (freaked out) What’s happening? Where have you been? I thought you might’ve--- BANG! The door slams from the outside. The dresser rocks the force. It’s not going to hold the door forever. Eli’s drops the bone on the ground, defeated.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: They're going to get in, Haley. You need to go before they see you.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: I don’t understand, Eli. You’re scaring me.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I’m not sick. I never was. Everything’s been a lie, and my parents are in on it. They didn’t bring me here to fix me, they brought me here to kill me. Haley looks at Eli with big wet eyes. She’s speechless. BANG! The door slams again. This time, the dresser actual moves. Not long now.

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have to go back home, Haley. Haley tries to give Eli her tough-girl routine. It doesn’ look so tough through tears, though.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: No, you can’t just let them-- Eli’s not affected.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: There’s nothing we can do now. Get your tent and go home. If they see you they’1l kill you too. BANG! The door slams again, moving the dresser even furth away. DAD'S HAND reaches through the space.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Help me push! Dad grips the side of the door and pushes. Seconds until they’re in the room. 8FLiX.com SCREENPLAY DATABASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haley stands her ground.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: I ain’t leaving you. Maybe if they see me, they’1ll stop and--

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (severely) You have to go.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: But---

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I said GO! Eli SMASHES the bone against the window as punctuation. I startles Haley, and for a moment, she’s frozen. But eventually, she turns tail and grabs her tent. She dashes away and disappears into the darkness. No trac her to be seen. Which is good, because suddenly Eli finds himself being lifted off his feet...

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Let go of me! Eli struggles against the weight of Dad as he holds him d on the medical bench. Dr. Horn finishes strapping him in.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HORN

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: But, what if---

dialogues.speaker: DR. HORN
dialogues.text: Please. Mom and Dad acquiesce and exit the room, shutting the doo behind them. Dr. Horn locks the door. 8FLiX.com SCREENPLAY DATABASE

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're crazy! Why are you doing this?! Dr. Horn stops what she’s doing. Breathes out a deep sigh She looks more exhausted than murderous. For the first time, she seems genuine, an odd time considering she’s getting ready to murder Eli.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HORN
dialogues.text: A lot of people have called me crazy. And maybe I am. I honestly thought I could cure you.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: You're not trying to cure me. You've been poisoning me just like you did the others.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HORN
dialogues.text: Eli, there’s so much you don’t know. So much you can’t know. The first three injections were Holy Water and Tannis Root. I thought perhaps on someone so young, it might work this time. But... She stops. Looks like she’s going to cry. Composes hersel and starts again. DR. dialogues.speaker: ELI

dialogues.speaker: DR. HORN
dialogues.text: The children always suffer from the sins of the parents. She moves in closer to Eli. DR. HORN (CONT’D) I'll ask the lord for forgiveness, Eli. I hope he grants it. Her face grows cold, her eyes steeled. She GAGS Eli’s mou She begins to read aloud from the bible: DR. HORN (CONT’D) Be sober-minded; be watchful. H SCREAMS OUT in pain, his eyes bulging. Muffled screams fr beneath his gag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Horn continues reading: DR. HORN (CONT’D) Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the schemes of the devil. dialogues.text: She flings more acidic liquid onto him. He SCREAMS OUT on more as the liquid burns into his flesh. DR. HORN (CONT’D) May Holy Water purify the skin... dialogues.text: Oh, Eli. What have you done? Eli advances towards them. His parents retreat back.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: What am I?

dialogues.text: No. Tell me the truth! As Eli gets angrier the fire behind him grows. Mom drops to her knees. Dad holds her.

dialogues.text: We didn’t listen. We wanted to be parents so badly. But when your Mom got pregnant...

dialogues.text: 8FLiX.com SCREENPLAY DATABASE
